titleproper.value: Guide to the James Lardner Papers <num>ALBA.067</num>

author.value: Collection processed by Jessica Weglein and Elizabeth Compa

publisher.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

addressline: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2017-07-20T17:20:39</date>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

abstract.value: James Lardner (1914-1938) was a journalist who enlisted in the Abraham Lincoln Brigade to fight against Franco's rebel forces in Spain. In March of 1938 Lardner traveled to Barcelona and after observing the war first hand, resolved to enlist in the Abraham Lincoln Brigade. He was killed in action in September 1938. The collection consist chiefly of correspondence; most of it produced by Lardner during his time in Paris and Spain and addressed to his mother Ellis and his brother Ring.

p.value: Materials are open to researchers. Please contact the Tamiment Library & Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives for more information and to schedule an appointment, tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu or 212-998-2630.

Published citations should take the following form: <lb/><lb/>Identification of item, date; Collection name; Collection number; box number; folder number; <lb/>Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives <lb/>Elmer Holmes Bobst Library <lb/>70 Washington Square South <lb/>New York, NY 10012, New York University Libraries.

<list><item>Lardner, Ring, Jr. <title render="italic">The Lardners: My Family Remembered</title>. (New York: Harper & Row Publishers, 1976.)</item><item>Sheean, Vincent. <title render="italic">Not Peace but a Sword.</title>(New York: Doubleday, Doran & Company, 1939.)</item></list>

Additional materials are clippings of articles about Lardner by Heywood Broun and Vincent Sheean; and an International Brigade citation made out to Lardner with a colorful battlefield graphic on the verso.

subject.value: Ebro River, Battle of the, Spain, 1938.

corpname.value: Spain. Ejercito Popular de la Republica. Abraham Lincoln Battalion
